description.para: Two constructor are defined for this class

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, long data_type, Tango::AttrWriteType w_type=Tango::READ, const char *assoc=AssocWritNotSpec)
memberdef.name: Attr

briefdescription.para: Constructs a newly allocated Attr object.

detaileddescription.para: The attribute display level is set to OPERATOR.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute type (read, write, read with write ...)
Name of the associated writable attribute. This is used only the read with write attribute

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, long data_type, Tango::DispLevel disp, Tango::AttrWriteType w_type=Tango::READ, const char *assoc=AssocWritNotSpec)
memberdef.name: Attr

briefdescription.para: Constructs a newly allocated Attr object.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute type (read, write, read with write ...)
Name of the associated writable attribute. This is used only the read with write attribute

description.para: Only one desctructor is defined for this class

briefdescription.para: Set the attribute polling update period.

Set the attribute as memorized in database (only for scalar and writable attribute) By default the setpoint will be written to the attribute during initialisation! Use method set_memorized_init() with false as argument if you don't want this feature.
Set the initialisation flag for memorized attributes true = the setpoint value will be written to the attribute on initialisation false = only the attribute setpoint is initialised.

detaileddescription.para: No action is taken on the attribute

parameterdescription.para: If true the setpoint value will be written to the attribute on initialisation

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires change events manually without the polling to be started for the attribute.

detaileddescription.para: If the detect parameter is set to true, the criteria specified for the change event are verified and the event is only pushed if they are fulfilled. If detect is set to false the event is fired without checking!

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires change events manually.
Triggers the verification of the change event properties when set to true.

briefdescription.para: Check if the change event is fired manually for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a manual fire change event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if the change event criteria should be checked when firing the event manually.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a change event criteria will be checked.

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires archive events manually without the polling to be started for the attribute If the detect parameter is set to true, the criteria specified for the archive event are verified and the event is only pushed if they are fulfilled.

detaileddescription.para: If detect is set to false the event is fired without checking!

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires archive events manually.
Triggers the verification of the archive event properties when set to true.

briefdescription.para: Check if the archive event is fired manually for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a manual fire archive event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if the archive event criteria should be checked when firing the event manually.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a archive event criteria will be checked.

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires data ready events.

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires data ready events

briefdescription.para: Check if the data ready event is fired for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if firing data ready event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: User class to create a no dimension attribute object.

detaileddescription.para: Information from this class and information fetched out from the Tango database allows the Tango core software to create the Attribute object for the attribute created by the user.
